description: Maximal number of subgroups in a group with n elements.
comments: For n >= 2 a(n)>=2 with equality iff n is prime.
links: Eric M. Schmidt, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..511
formula: a(n)=Maximum of {A061034(n), A083573(n)}. - _Lekraj Beedassy_, Oct 22 2004(C_2)^m has A006116(m) subgroups, so this is a lower bound if n is a power of 2 (e.g. a(16) >= 67). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 01 2007
example: a(6) = 6 because there are two groups with 6 elements: C_6 with 4 subgroups and S_3 with 6 subgroups.
author: Ola Veshta (olaveshta(AT)my-deja.com), May 23 2001
extensions: More terms from Victoria A. Sapko (vsapko(AT)canes.gsw.edu), Jun 13 2003
More terms from _Eric M. Schmidt_, Sep 07 2012
